meanings.definition: To describe someone or something inaccurately or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: She keeps mischaracterizing my actions as intentional when they were accidental.
meanings.sent2: The news article was mischaracterizing the situation by only focusing on one side of the story.
meanings.sent3: The detective mischaracterizing the suspect's alibi as suspicious led to a humorous misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: Her exaggerated retelling of events was mischaracterizing reality into a dramatic soap opera.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting skillfully captured the essence of mischaracterizing reality through distorted shapes and colors.

meanings.definition: To present someone or something in a false or misleading way.
meanings.sent1: Stop mischaracterizing my words to make me look bad!
meanings.sent2: The advertisement was mischaracterizing the product's effectiveness to boost sales.
meanings.sent3: The comedian mischaracterizing his own height in a joke made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The movie's clever plot twist was mischaracterizing the villain as a hero all along.
meanings.sent5: The magician's illusion was a perfect example of mischaracterizing reality to deceive the audience's eyes.
